description: Verify that Level 4 'The White Hat Test' can be started correctly with proper authentication and prerequisite checking
scenario: User starts Level 4 from the levels page after completing Level 3 to begin ethical hacking training
expected_results: Navigate to simulation page, initialize SimulatedPC with Level 4 data, and begin boot sequence
procedure:
1. Complete Level 3 to unlock Level 4
2. Log in as authenticated user
3. Navigate to /levels
4. Click 'Start Level' button on Level 4 card
5. Verify navigation to /levels/4/start
6. Check simulation page loads with correct level data
7. Confirm SimulatedPC initializes with Level 4 information

description: Verify complete end-to-end workflow for Level 4 from start to completion with comprehensive ethical hacking skill development
scenario: User completes entire ethical hacking training gaining penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and professional ethics skills
expected_results: Complete workflow provides engaging cybersecurity education covering ethical hacking methodology, penetration testing, and responsible disclosure in professional context
procedure:
1. Start Level 4 from levels page after completing Level 3
2. Experience simulation boot sequence and professional ethical hacking environment initialization
3. Receive introduction to ethical hacking scenario with proper authorization and scope definition
4. Access comprehensive penetration testing interface with professional-grade security tools
5. Study and apply ethical hacking methodology following industry standards (OWASP, NIST, PTES)
6. Perform systematic reconnaissance and information gathering within authorized scope
7. Execute network and service enumeration using professional tools
8. Conduct comprehensive vulnerability assessment with CVSS scoring and risk analysis
9. Practice controlled exploitation techniques in authorized lab environment
10. Implement advanced penetration testing techniques including privilege escalation
11. Conduct web application security testing following OWASP methodology
12. Perform network infrastructure assessment and protocol analysis
13. Execute ethical social engineering assessment focused on awareness improvement
14. Apply advanced vulnerability research and zero-day discovery techniques
15. Generate professional penetration testing reports with executive summaries and technical details
16. Practice responsible disclosure protocols and vendor communication
17. Study legal and ethical guidelines for professional cybersecurity consulting
18. Ensure compliance with industry regulations and standards (PCI DSS, HIPAA, SOX)
19. Complete all ethical hacking challenges while maintaining professional ethical standards
20. Trigger level completion dialogue and earn 350 XP in Ethical Hacking
21. Receive appropriate badges for penetration testing and ethical hacking expertise
22. Call completion API to unlock Level 5 (The Hunt for The Null)
23. Exit simulation through proper shutdown sequence
24. Return to levels page with updated progress and Level 5 unlocked
25. Verify comprehensive skill development in penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and ethical hacking essential for expert-level cybersecurity professional practice

description: Verify Level 4 simulation maintains performance during intensive penetration testing operations
scenario: System performance remains stable during resource-intensive vulnerability scanning and exploitation testing
expected_results: Smooth performance during network scanning, vulnerability assessment, and exploitation with responsive interface
procedure:
1. Monitor performance during comprehensive network scans
2. Check responsiveness during vulnerability assessments
3. Verify UI remains responsive during exploitation tests
4. Test memory usage during intensive penetration testing
5. Check CPU utilization during concurrent tool usage
6. Verify network performance during assessment activities
7. Test simulation stability under expert-level operations

description: Verify Level 4 penetration testing interfaces meet accessibility standards for screen readers and keyboard navigation
scenario: Penetration testing tools and interfaces are accessible to users with disabilities through proper accessibility features
expected_results: Ethical hacking interfaces support keyboard navigation, screen readers, and accessibility standards
procedure:
1. Navigate penetration testing interfaces using only keyboard
2. Test with screen reader for proper content reading
3. Verify focus indicators on security tool elements
4. Check proper ARIA labels for penetration testing components
5. Test modal accessibility and focus management
6. Verify color contrast meets accessibility standards
7. Check vulnerability report accessibility features

description: Verify the ethical hacking scenario context is properly established for the penetration testing challenge
scenario: User receives introduction to the ethical hacking environment with authorized testing scope and legal boundaries
expected_results: Ethical hacking environment with clear authorization, scope definition, and responsible disclosure protocols
procedure:
1. Complete simulation boot sequence
2. Verify ethical hacking scenario introduction
3. Check authorization documentation display
4. Confirm testing scope boundaries are clearly defined
5. Verify responsible disclosure protocol explanation
6. Check legal and ethical guidelines presentation
7. Confirm 30-minute expert-level completion time context
